ans.reasoning: The method setSelected in OptionGroup throws AlreadySelectedException if an option from the group has already been selected. The stack trace indicates that this exception was thrown, suggesting that the logic for managing selected options in groups may be faulty.

The updateRequiredOptions method is responsible for updating the selected option in the group. If this method does not correctly handle the selection logic, it could lead to the AlreadySelectedException being thrown.
The processProperties method processes properties and adds options. If it incorrectly adds an option that conflicts with an already selected option, it could trigger the exception.

The parse method in the Parser class is responsible for parsing command line options. If it does not correctly handle option groups or their required status, it could lead to the exception being thrown.
